H1254.tr: to create / to make / to form
H1254.m: Verb Qal Perfect 3rd person masculine singular
mn: to create, to make, to form (exclusively of divine creation)
of God: creating the universe, heaven and earth, Gen. 1:1
to bring into existence something new, unique, not previously existing
to create a clean heart, Ps. 51:10
used only with God as subject in Qal stem
distinct from יָצַר (to form) and עָשָׂה (to make, do)
H1254.strong_original: בָּרָא bârâʼ, baw-raw'; a primitive root; (absolutely) to create; (qualified) to cut down (a wood), select, feed (as formative processes):—choose, create (creator), cut down, dispatch, do, make (fat).

english.primary: to create, to bring into existence (in divine sense)

definitions.etymology: Proto-Semitic root *brʔ, related to the idea of bringing forth, unique creation

biblical: Genesis 1:1 - 'In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth'
Genesis 1:27 - 'So God created man in his own image'
Psalm 51:10 - 'Create in me a clean heart, O God'
Isaiah 43:1 - 'I have created you, O Israel'

examples: God created the world ex nihilo (out of nothing).
An artist creates a painting, but only God creates life.

references.theological: Doctrine of creation, theology of nature
